The idea was entertaining and cool but the follow threw was underwhelming. Thanos got the stones with relatively no struggle, we don't know much about him, why did he think wiping out half of them would fix it? Why kill your own and not take over another plant? We could have learned about him. Crossing over 3 movie lines they didn't really cross over orhave good introductions. Thor was to easily accepted, and
What a load of trash this film turned out to be. Neither the wine or Chris Evans' beard could maintain my interest through this film

A fantastic movie. One of the most enjoyable films to watch. I cannot believe Marvel took so many storylines and weave them together seamlessly. The movie was amazing and pretty easy to follow. It was great to see all our favorite characters working together. SPOILER ALERT: marvel only killed off our favorite characters to make money A) off this movie B) off Captain Marvel and C) off the next Avengers... Captain Marvel can time travel. Peter Parker is coming back!!!!!!!!

Fantastic! I'm very glad marvel didn't write it in a dumbed down way so that it makes sense in its own, without the other movies. It has a hell of a lot of characters but it works because the audience is already familiar with them.
Too much drama but it deserves 5 stars...
One of the best cliffhangers of modern movies. Great pacing and unexpected twists. It'll have all of us talking about it right up until Avengers 4.

Amazing movie with a huge cast of Marvel characters. With the last crap show addition to the Star Wars franchise this has definitely become my fave franchise. Quite long but never felt too long. In fact, it seemed to be a bit rushed at times. It could have been longer in my mind. I cant wait till next May.

This movie was a grand spectacle that deserves every single cent us fans shell out to see it. The only ones I see even giving this movie a rotten score seem to be the snobby, head-up-asses critics who have no idea how the grand scale of the MCU works. This movie is for us fans. So you critics, please take the sticks from your butts and leave the town of Footloose.

Infinity War is a fun ride, but it is important to understand what it is - this movie is a chapter in a larger whole, a climactic battle that the previous movies have been building toward.  Don't look for in-depth character development here; this is a knock-down, drag-out fight, start to finish.  In short, MCU fans have been eagerly awaiting this movie for years and should enjoy it immensely, but curious non-fans would be completely lost, much as one would be if one were to skip most of the chapters of a book and start near its climax.  Excellent fare for its target audience.
